column1: succu-bunbun 161068857235 "2017-05-25 20:44:18 GMT" https://succu-bunbun.tumblr.com/post/161068857235/pervertsofcolor-straight-beat-tomboykink "pervertsofcolor: straight-beat:  tomboykink:  pervertsofcolor:  Met a cute girl. She gave me her STI results and said she was â€œcleanâ€.  I hate that phrase so fucking hard.  I have family with various medical conditions and it doesnâ€™t make them dirty. Iâ€™ve also had partners with STIs and you just have to be tested often
column2: use protection and be a little creative. I am negative for STIs and I keep copies of my paperwork but I didnâ€™t even tell her that cuz her response pissed me off so bad.  Now she stopped talking to me. I guess
column3: Iâ€™m dirty too? The fuck?  The language you use matters. Your status is either negative or positive.  THANK YOU.  Related rant: Iâ€™ve had people flip out at me because I say STI status isnâ€™t an instant dealbreaker as long as we can have an honest conversation about it and what precautions need to be taken. Like
column4: not only is there the shame on people who have them (hence the â€œdirtyâ€ language)
column5: but if you donâ€™t immediately reject and ostracize anyone you know who has or had ever had one
column6: youâ€™re a bad person too for not beating up on them? What the hell. I had a long-term relationship with somebody with HSV2 and when I went to get specialized testing after we broke up
column7: the doctor grilled me on our safer sex practices and then told me that honestly heâ€™d do the tests but he already knew I didnâ€™t have it (and I didnâ€™t). Iâ€™ve had several conversations with my sexual health providers related to this - that â€œjust never get within breathing distance of somebody who isnâ€™t â€˜cleanâ€™â€ is fallacious and shameful. Meanwhile
column8: I guarantee you that people are walking around with STIs that are undiagnosed or that they donâ€™t tell people about because of the stigma. My most recent ex-boyfriend lied to me for like 2+ years about an unprotected one-night stand he had with some random person while heavily intoxicated because he was so invested in the image of himself as a person who would ~never do that~ until it turned out there was a very real possibility that he might have something incurable as a result. It turned out to be a false positive
column9: but I got slapped with the emotional labor of coddling him through his shame because he was too self-centered to admit heâ€™d done something to put me at risk. Hell
column10: when I found out my first girlfriend ever was sleeping with other people and lying to me about it
column11: her defense was that it was cool that she didnâ€™t want to talk to me about it because â€œlesbians donâ€™t get STDs anyway.â€ My ex
column12: who gave me chlamydia years ago (which incidentally my doc referred to as â€œthe strep throat of STIsâ€)
column13: was so insulted that I asked him to get tested before we slept together. His exact words were â€œthe girls Iâ€™ve been with arenâ€™t the type to get STDs.â€ I lit him up
column14: because wtf does that even mean
column16: and by that I mean he FAKED HIS TEST RESULTS because that was easier and less shameful somehow than going to the doctor.  Itâ€™s not about STIs. Itâ€™s about consent and respecting people enough to be honest with them.  I never even knew the word â€œcleanâ€ could be perceived like that. Damn.  Iâ€™m reblogging this because I recently had a partner send me fake STI results and it feels like complete bullshit. Because of this
column17: I got checked out at Planned Parenthood last week. Iâ€™m negative for STIs yet I feel lied to. If people could/would openly talk about health concerns then this wouldnâ€™t happen. Please have real conversations about safer sex with your partners. " False text

You are just a body to be masturbated to. What you are doing is not work and I do not want to spread your links for my own selfish reasons. column2: I would not have ever seen this masterful gifset because you wouldnâ€™t have made it because you werenâ€™t getting paid to do so. So I am going to be selfish and use your labor in a way that only benefits me because I can.  Donâ€™t. Delete. Captions. Ever.  If someone does delete the captions

column1: succu-bunbun 160999321007 "2017-05-23 22:30:30 GMT" https://succu-bunbun.tumblr.com/post/160999321007/okhaley-thisnameisquitegooey "okhaley:  thisnameisquitegooey:  dear-miss-adair:  voidbat:  baphomeme:  im serious about thatÂ â€œstop saving things for special occasionsâ€ bit tho like. even if u arenâ€™t in your 20s. thats for everyone. its one of the most useful things ive learned lately stop! just stop. eat the special snack. drink the expensive hippie tea. use the incense or the bath bomb or whatever you paid way too much for because you were feeling really bad and retail therapy makes u feel alive when we save things for special occasions/rainy days it contributes to us feeling like A.) our day to day existence is lackluster and B.) you have to be feeling a certain level of Bad
column2: or have to reach a certain level of Socially Accepted Achievement
column3: to enjoy things just give yourself stuff. there are definitely sometimes reasons to withhold things from yourself - as motivation
column4: if itâ€™s something you consciously want to use sparingly
column5: etc - but at least for me half the time it just turns into self-flagellation and also cool things and cool experiences and nice treats just collect dust while i wait for some fabled day when i convince myself i finally Deserve it just fuckin give yourself stuff dude. lifeâ€™s so mindblowingly short  my grandmother died having only used her china like twice in her life. during the year or so before her death
column6: she was starting to package up and give things of hers to her kids
column7: and gave mom the china while sighing â€œoh i wish i had used the china more!â€ and mom tried so hard to convince her to just keep it
column9: and eat corny dogs off it if she wanted. she insisted she couldnâ€™t possibly
column10: you need a special reason to use the fine china.when nana died
column11: we used her fine china as our everyday dishes for years. i was 18 when she died
column12: and never really stopped having that in the back of my head. now
column13: when i hear myself say â€œi wish i had a reason to wear/do/eat/use X!â€ i hear nana regretting never really using her china. and let me tell you a thing:spaghettios taste great when eaten from fine china.  Iâ€™ve seen this post making the rounds. Just wanted to add something to it that my sister-in-law once told me: â€œA â€˜special thingâ€™ can make any occasion special.â€ She told me this when I objected to her opening a really expensive bottle of champagne just to watch a movie. And you know
column14: she was right. The champagne was amazing and while we always sit around and watch movies
column15: that bottle made that night a really special occasion that I will always remember.  So
column16: cut yourself a little slack and remember that an ordinary day can become special.   My mother has always had a habit of buying what she calls â€œlove giftsâ€. Essentially she would buy me my favorite snack or take me to get iced coffee or buy me fuzzy socks something like that Her reason for that was simply because she thought of us at work and wanted to get something as a way of saying â€œI was thinking about you and I love youâ€ Now as a kid I just took the presents but when I got older I felt a little bad She didnâ€™t always buy something small
column17: sometimes it was some new makeup or video games or something else that was more than just a few bucks When I told her â€œhey mom itâ€™s sweet that you do this
column18: but you donâ€™t have to go do this all the time. You can just wait until a special day or a special occasionâ€ She just looked at me and said â€œbut Samantha
column20: and I love you every day not just the special onesâ€ And ever since she said that I havenâ€™t objected again  This is so important!!! Iâ€™ve done this my whole life but have been trying to break the HABIT. By holding back these desirable things from yourself for a time that you feel worthy
column21: you are adding to the intrusive thoughts that you are not good enough
column22: that someone is more deserving than you.Wear your favorite shirt to the grocery store too
column23: not just on your birthday or the first date with a guy who youâ€™ve met once before. Wear your favorite shirt ESPECIALLY when you donâ€™t â€œfeel worthyâ€.  If a dog has a favorite toy itâ€™s not going to ignore it and play with a different one simply to appeal to this notion that we have to earn happiness and enjoyment.  Yes there are â€œspecial daysâ€ but ultimately there are just â€œdaysâ€ and you only have so many.  Tl; dr: Wear the clothes

column1: succu-bunbun 160944270022 "2017-05-22 11:21:55 GMT" https://succu-bunbun.tumblr.com/post/160944270022/vastderp-bracelet00-cakecourse-can-we "vastderp:  bracelet00:  cakecourse:  Can we normalize the idea that women can have deep voices? please??  Especially for trans women who feel gross or out of place for their deep voice.  Please
column2: break the standard that all women have high pitched
column4: feminine voices.  My car got towed on NYE
column5: so after unsuccessfully trying every number programmed into my phone
column6: I called my dadâ€™s ass up at 2 AM to pick up myself and my friends to go get my vehicle out of impound (my dad is awesome. More on that later.)  Included in my group of friends was my friend Anna who had recently come forward as trans. She had very recently started presenting as a woman
column7: and was pretty insecure in it
column8: and had never met my father previously
column9: so it wasnâ€™t as though I had time to brief him on the situation. Anna was pretty shy during the whole ride
column10: tucked in the back and letting her friends talk over her. She only spoke up after I had gotten my car back
column11: thanking him for helping out. The next day
column12: I called to thank him for that night
column13: and he asked me who was the girl with the deep voice. At first my heart sink in my guts
column15: he started raving about how he LOVED her voice. He listed off a few actresses from his day who had had very deep voices
column17: and that kind of slow sultry speaking had been fading more and more as pop culture pushed for childish voices in women. Your deep voice is gorgeous trans friends (and cis friends too.) it is warm and low and smooth like honey and perfect in every way. It is smoldering and evocative and absolutely beautiful.  Growly lady voices do me the pitter pat!. Nomi from sense 8 has a perfect smoky voice that just feels great in my ears  It took a shitton of work to bring my voice anywhere near high
column18: and I canâ€™t sing without bringing it lower
column19: and this makes me feel really happy. Deep voices are good as heck. <3" False text
